(8B) Regulations under subsection (8A), may include persons who are—
text.IndentOne: (c) the owner of a commonhold tenancy,

text.quote: 000: Clause 69, page 120, line 6, at end insert—
“( ) The meaning of “household premises” in regulations under subsection (4) must include mixed hereditaments.”
000: Clause 69, page 120, line 14, at end insert—

“(7) Except as provided in subsection (8), the definition of “household premises” in any regulations made for the purposes of this Part must not include or exclude persons by reason of the premises being (or not being) owned or occupied by the policyholder or any other person of a specified description or because the premises are, or are not, owned by, or the policyholder is or is not, an individual.
(8) The definition of “household premises” may exclude premises where the policyholder or the owner of the premises is—
text.IndentOne: (a) a corporation or company incorporated by statute or Royal Charter or under the Companies Acts (other than small companies within the meaning of section 382 of the Companies Act 2006 or medium companies within the meaning of section 468 of that Act);
(b) a person or body specified in paragraph 12 in Schedule 1 to the Housing Act 1988;
(c) a registered provider of social housing, or

text.quote: 000: After Clause 73, insert the following new Clause—
“Internal drainage boards: apportionment of drainage expenses
(1) The Land Drainage Act 1991 is amended as follows.
(2) In section 37 (apportionment of drainage expenses), at end insert—
text.IndentOne: “(f) in the case of—the Secretary of State may by order define an equivalent measure for valuing the land”.”
text.IndentTwo: (i) any land to which none of paragraphs (a) to (d) applies and is it not possible to calculate a value under paragraph (e)(ii) as the relevant rating lists no longer exist or cannot be located, or
(ii) land to which one of paragraphs (a) to (c) does apply but for which the relevant rating lists no longer exist or cannot be located,
the Secretary of State may by order define an equivalent measure for valuing the land”.”
